original_title: Court prevents TUs from entering Galle Face
original_body_lines: Colombo Additional Magistrate Thilina Gamage on Tuesday (4) issued an order preventing four trade union representatives from entering the areas where the President's House, President's Office, Finance Ministry are located at, and Galle Face Green. The order is in effect until 5 PM on Tuesday (4).

The Colombo Additional Magistrate issued the order on Wasantha Samarasinghe, Joint-Chairman of the Joint People's Movement, Udeni Dissanayake, Joint-Chairman of the Joint People's Movement, Bandula Saman Kumara, Chairman of the CPC Branch of the Commerce, Industries and Services Progressive Employees Union, Ravi Kumudesh, Convener of the Joint Council of Professions Supplementary to Medicine, and other members who would be party to their group.

The court order notes that from noon to 5 PM on Tuesday (4), the said individuals are not permitted to enter the areas where the President's House, President's Office, Finance Ministry are located at, and Galle Face Green along Olcott Mawatha from the Fort Railway Station to the CTO Junction, CTO Junction to Ceramic Junction, NSA Roundabout to Lotus Road, York Street, Bank of Ceylon Mawatha, Janadhipathi Mawatha, Sir Baron Jayathilake Mawatha, Baladaksha Mawatha, Chathya Road, and from Galle Face Roundabout to NSA Roundabout.
Sri Lanka Police said that the Fort Police OIC requested the court order the protestors not to obstruct the roads, and not cause any inconvenience to the public and vehicles using the said roads.
